sarad.cluster¶

Module to handle a cluster of SARAD instruments.

All instruments forming a cluster are connected to the same instrument controller. SaradCluster is used as singleton.

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

SaradCluster

Class to define a cluster of SARAD instruments

class sarad.cluster.SaradCluster(native_ports: Optional[List[str]] = None, ignore_ports: Optional[List[str]] = None)¶

Bases: Generic[sarad.sari.SI]

Class to define a cluster of SARAD instruments that are all connected to one controller

Properties:

native_ports ignore_ports active_ports connected_instruments start_time

Public methods:

version :str = 3.0¶
static get_instrument(device_id, port) → Optional[sarad.sari.SI]¶

Get the instrument object for an instrument with know device_id that is connected to a known port

Parameters

  • device_id (str) – device id of the instrument encoding family, type and serial number

  • port (str) – id of the serial device the instrument is connected to

Returns

SaradInst object

__iter__(self) → Iterator[sarad.sari.SI]¶
synchronize(self, cycles_dict: Dict[str, int]) → bool¶

Stop measuring cycles of all connected instruments. Set instrument time to UTC on all instruments. Start measuring cycle on all instruments according to dictionary in cycles_dict.

update_connected_instruments(self, ports_to_test=None, ports_to_skip=None) → List[sarad.sari.SI]¶

Update the list of connected instruments in self.__connected_instruments and return this list.

Parameters

ports_to_test (List[str]) – list of serial device ids to test. If None, the function will test all serial devices in self.active_ports. If given, the function will test serial devices in ports_to_test and add newly detected instruments to self.__connected_instruments. If no instrument can be found on one of the ports, the instrument will be removed from self.__connected_instruments.

Returns

List of instruments added to self.__connected_instruments. [] if instruments have been removed.

dump(self, file: IO[bytes]) → None¶

Save the cluster information to a file.

property active_ports(self) → List[str]¶

SARAD instruments can be connected: 1. by RS232 on a native RS232 interface at the computer 2. via their built in FT232R USB-serial converter 3. via an external USB-serial converter (Prolific, Prolific fake, FTDI) 4. via the SARAD ZigBee coordinator with FT232R

property connected_instruments(self) → List[sarad.sari.SI]¶

Return list of connected instruments.

property native_ports(self) → Optional[List[str]]¶

Return the list of all native serial ports (RS-232 ports) available at the instrument controller.

property ignore_ports(self) → Optional[List[str]]¶

Return the list of all serial ports at the instrument controller that shall be ignored.

property start_time(self) → datetime.datetime¶

Get a pre-defined start time for all instruments in this cluster.
